messages: 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (10:56): is it true that the lists.w3.org archives aren't indexed by Google?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:57): http://www.google.com/search?sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=site:lists.w3.org
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:57): Results 1 - 10 of about 1,080,000 from lists.w3.org
4bef48592155dfcdb58625a06707f169 (10:58): how come i have about 1,520,000
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:59): it's an approximation
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:59): probably based on how many servers responded, and you probably hit a different data center than i do
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:59): Quite a bad one it seems :)
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (10:59): how come my searches never find anything
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:00): (i actually have no idea what it's based on)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:00): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427: what are you looking or?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:00): It should just say results 1-10 of about 1E6
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (11:00): www-style making pt a physical unit
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:00): 4bef48592155dfcdb58625a06707f169, also, google.se returns different resutls from google.com
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (11:00): that query doesn't even bring up lists.w3.org in the top-10
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:00): http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&safe=off&q=site:lists.w3.org+www-style+making+pt+a+physical+unit&aq=f&oq=&aqi=
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:01): i guess lists.w3.org just doesn't seem very useful to google's algorithms
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:01): hard to argue with that position :-P
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (11:01): "www-style archive" brings up lists.w3.org as the top hit
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (11:02): but just http://lists.w3.org, not, say, "<email/> Mail Archives" (http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-style/)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:02): weird
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:03): you can if you search for that a lot, click "add a result" at the bottom, and enter that URL for that query
4bef48592155dfcdb58625a06707f169 (11:03): http://www.bing.com/search?q=www-style+making+pt+a+physical+unit&go=&form=QBLH&filt=all
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (11:04): search for 'w3c dysfunctional'
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (11:04): that brings up lists.w3c.org right away
4bef48592155dfcdb58625a06707f169 (11:04): clearly bing is better than google
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (11:04): lists.w3.org that is - public-html
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:04): I tried to use Bing as my default engine for a couple of hours and then went back to Google due to search quality issues
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:05): though it could be that only Bing's Finland region sucks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:05): Bing seems to insist on making the search results locale-sensitive--badly
4bef48592155dfcdb58625a06707f169 (11:06): there should be an <input type=range> for locale-senitiveness
4bef48592155dfcdb58625a06707f169 (11:07): when i search for an article about some topic, i don't care about locale at all
4bef48592155dfcdb58625a06707f169 (11:07): but when i search for a restaurant, i do
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:08): GPS-assisted restaurant search on Google Maps Mobile is awesome
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:08): (when outside Helsinki, that is. for Helsinki, there's a specialized service that beats Google on restaurants)
4bef48592155dfcdb58625a06707f169 (11:08): maybe search engines could figure out from the query whether to be locale-sensitive or not
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:14): I believe they try with varying levels of success
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (11:15): Bing IS better than Google
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (11:15): I should pay more attention to Asa
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (11:16): I think Google tries to be locale-sensitive with great success
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (11:17): my search for "empress garden" returns the correct Auckland restaurant as the top hit (actually the top several hits) ... I haven't searched for it before
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:18): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427: I tried to pay attention to Asa's recommendation, but the results were bad for me.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (11:18): I was being sarcastic
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (11:19): I don't have an "add a result" option on Google
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (11:20): sends feedback
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:21): Y! outsourcing their search to Bing doesn't improve the state of competition :-(
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:28): 4bef48592155dfcdb58625a06707f169: http://weblogs.mozillazine.org/asa/archives/2009/12/if_you_have_nothing.html
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:29): aargh. are data: URLs that don't have <script> elements synchronously navigated to in WebKit?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:36): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427: are you logged into google?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:36): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427: if you're logged in, it should be the first link on the left under the Goooooooogle paginator
4bef48592155dfcdb58625a06707f169 (11:37): hmm, seems MessageChannel is supported in webkit but not in firefox
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:37): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: are you actively following the about:blank discussion in dev.platform?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:38): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: not actively
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:38): so far it seems that about:blank navigation isn't fully synchronous in Gecko and WebKit
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:39): but might be in Opera and IE8
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:39): when is it not?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:39): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/test/bz-about-blank.html
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:40): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: if the http URL is changed to a data URL, then WebKit acts like Opera
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:43): bring it up in #webkit
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:43): or on the whatwg list
